Message.Title: DRAM $4.4 UP 5%....BREAKOUT ALERT..TARGET $30+…WHY?: 1) HUGE MEMORY MANUFACTURING DEAL WITH AMD, 2) MEMORY PRICES WAY UP, 3) DIVERSIFICATION
Message.Msg: The two biggest reasons for DRAM’s incredible upside from today’s prices are discussed below. In addition to these recent developments, DRAM will benefit from skyrocketing memory prices (it's main core business for the last several decades). DRAM was already on the verge of profitability even before the 2 factors mentioned above will have a significant positive effect on earnings in the current and future quarters, . The current 0.2 X sales compared to 1.5 sector average is ridiculous and will be corrected soon. DRAM’s current market cap is only $8 million. There only 1.4M tightly held shares on the float. 1) AMD and DRAM announced in May (5/8/2013 AMD Press Release and 5/12/2013 DRAMPress Release) that DRAM will begin manufacturing all new AMD Gamer Series memory modules and will provide it's RAMDisk software to drive all AMD Radeon products. The Gamer Series memory is compatible with AMD and Intel platforms, supporting both AMP and XMP memory profiles. Recent reviews rank AMD Gamer Series memory the fastest and more reliable for gaming and other applications requiring super-fast processing speeds. "AMD Radeon RG2133 Gamer Series Memory is armed with features designed to outperform the competition on any task," said Roman Kyrychynskyi, product director, Graphics Business Unit, AMD. "Designed with multi-platform compatibility in mind, the AMD Radeon RG2133 brings cutting-edge technology, as well as uncompromising quality and compatibility for PC gamers. "AMD and Dataram have worked together to significantly enhance the dynamic background load-and-save feature in order to create a seamless, non-volatile RAMDisk experience," said Jason Caulkins, CTO, Dataram. "This underscores AMD and Dataram's continued dedication to delivering the highest-performing memory products. 2) DRAM is also pursuing it's RAMDisk technology in the energy, banking, simulations, military, medical, and other sectors requiring super-fast processing speeds

Topic.Title: How will bac react if AIG wins in court ??? I think IT IS currently a MAJOR weight on SP

Message.Msg: Not saying it will be a non event if the judge rejects the settlement. I think her approval will mostly be a non event since this has been out there for a long time. A larger potential event that I think everyone has forgotten is the $10 billion lawsuit AIG has outstanding against BAC that is separate from this. That one has yet to play out, although AIG was successful in getting it transferred from federal court to NY state court. The wild card will be whether the Feds telling BAC they wouldn't be liable since this lawsuit involves the bonds the Feds took over from AIG becomes an overriding factor. AIG is working hard to prove that the Feds had no right to make that statement and that BAC is, therefore, liable.

Message.Title: Libs spin this msm coverup, and you had better do it face, because holder should be forced to charge the perps or resign
Message.Msg: Meet Joshua Heath Chellow, 36. Like many others, he assumed the early hours of July 1st were going to be another regular day filled with the normal day-to-day activities of life in middle class America – a day that included stopping for gas at a Marbleton, GA gas station in the suburbs of Atlanta. Unfortunately for Joshua, filling up his tank meant he had to exit his vehicle. Joshua had the misfortune of the same condition that afflicted George Zimmerman that fateful and now infamous night of Feb 26th, 2012 – REWW. (*) Apparently that was sufficient enough for him to be “Trayvonned”. The media is silent on what compelled the attackers, but what is known is that Joshua was set upon and mercilessly beaten in a life-threatening attack by a group of four “unarmed” black males. In a desperate attempt at self-preservation, Joshua began backing away from his attackers – stumbling onto the parkway in front of the gas station where he was run over by a passing car. The driver of the vehicle stopped, rendered aid and called 9-11 but Joshua died of his injuries. Did any of you know about this attack? No. Because the media reported it as a “hit and run fatality” while deliberately refusing to discuss the events the preceded the fatal “hit and run”. This is where you need to sit up and pay attention. In addition to deliberately suppressing the full, true story of what happened to Joshua, the corporate media made a deliberate and coordinated editorial effort to spin the story: MABLETON, Ga. – Cobb County police hope to catch the hit-and-run driver who fatally struck 36-year-old Joshua Heath Chellew of Mableton as he walked along Mableton Parkway early Sunday. The sanitization of this egregious racially motivated hate crime by the corporate media commenced almost immediately. The national media refused to even entertain discussion about the Scheme Team fallout from the “Justice for Trayvon” rhetoric. Three of the four accused are 18 years of age – or in the venacular of John Guy, simply misguided youths a mere 24 mths past the tender age of 16.

Message.Title: DRAM $4.78 UP 11% TODAY .... UP 30% SINCE LAST WEEK...BREAKOUT TO DOUBLE DIGITS JUST AHEAD...WAS $35 IN 2010
Message.Msg: DRAM highlights: - In business since 1967 – survived recessions/instability/uncertainty while many companies folded - Trades @ 0.2 X sales. The sector average is 1.5 times sales. - DRAM’s market cap is $8 million. - 1.4M shares float. Major Catalysts for Explosive Profitable Growth relative to its current valuation: 1) DRAM is and will benefit from skyrocketing memory prices (it's main core business for the last several decades). DRAM was almost profitable last quarter when memory prices were still near a bottom. Since the start of the quarter to be reported next week DRAM prices have increased about 70% 2) AMD and DRAM announced in May (5/8/2013 AMD Press Release and 5/12/2013 DRAMPress Release) that DRAM will begin manufacturing all new AMD Gamer Series memory modules and will provide it's RAMDisk software to drive all AMD Radeon products. The Gamer Series memory is compatible with AMD and Intel platforms, supporting both AMP and XMP memory profiles. Recent reviews rank AMD Gamer Series memory as the fastest and more reliable for gaming and other applications. "AMD Radeon RG2133 Gamer Series Memory is armed with features designed to outperform the competition on any task," said Roman Kyrychynskyi, product director, Graphics Business Unit, AMD. "Designed with multi-platform compatibility in mind, the AMD Radeon RG2133 brings cutting-edge technology, as well as uncompromising quality and compatibility for PC gamers. "AMD and Dataram have worked together to significantly enhance the dynamic background load-and-save feature in order to create a seamless, non-volatile RAMDisk experience," said Jason Caulkins, CTO, Dataram. "This underscores AMD and Dataram's continued dedication to delivering the highest-performing memory products. 3) DRAM is looking into diversifying with its RAMDisk software technology into many verticals needing faster and faster computing processing speeds such as the energy, banking, military, defense, government, NASA, medical, etc..
